div.pre: 1790 Malayer, c. 65 km. SE of Hamadan (anc. Ecbatana), Media, c. 1934 Burial: c. 375 B.C. (Robinson, Schlum- berger; see note below) Contents: 394+ AR Messana: 1 tetradr. Syracuse: 4 tetradr.; 1 didr. Alexander I, Macedonia: 3 octadr. Bisaltae: 2 octadr. Acanthus: 8 tetradr. Terone: 1 tetradr. Corcyra: 3 st. Leucas: 1 st. Thebes: 3 st. Athens: 1 decadr., 163 tetradr.; 1 didr.; 2 dr. Aegina: 45 st. Melos: 6 st. Sinope: 2 dr. Clazomenae: 1 didr. Chios: 1 didr. Samos: 2 tetradr. "Caunus": 1 st. Cnidus: 1 dr. Carpathus: 1 st. Lindus: 1 st. Lycia: 5 st. Persian Satrap, Asia Minor: 1 tetradr. (as Traité II.2, nos. 74 ff.) Citium: 2 st. Salamis: 1 st. Sidon: 6 double-shekels; 23 half-shekels; 1 1/16 shekel Tyre: 89 shekels; 9 quarter-shekels Persia: 1 siglos Barce: 1 tetradr. Disposition: Teheran 306 Robinson, Iraq 1950, pp. 50-1 Schlumberger, L'argent grècque, pp. 50-4 Kraay-Moorey, RN 1968, pp. 222-8, 232 Troxell-Spengler ANSMN 15 (1969), pp. 15-6 Robinson regards the satrapal coin of Asia Minor as possibly intrusive, in which case the burial date will be c. 375 B.C.
